title: Problems with Marshmallow on Moto E2, any help?

thread.text:
Hope someone can help!
I have multiple problems after my Moto E2 upgraded to Marshmallow recently.
1) My phone connects to my PC, but just shows 'empty folder' rather than the contents of internal storage and SD card as it did with Lollipop. I have found various solutions on-line, but all involve going into developer mode.
2) I can't get into developer mode. I had done so in Lollipop - now 7 taps - even 17 taps, on Build number just brings up part of an unmovable magnified image of the about phone menu - it certainly doesn't get me into developer mode. Clicking on developer options just shows developer options are not available to this user.
3) Home and Settings buttons don't work. They light up and vibrate when I tap them but they do nothing. So now, how do I switch quickly between apps - eg to copy from a web site into Keep or copy and paste between documents? And how do I get quickly back into the Home menu without backing out of each individual page? (I use Smart Launcher)
4) Why has the name of the SD card changed to a 8 digit code? What was wrong with SD card 1?
5) I seem to have less space in Internal Storage for Apps, and under apps in settings there seems to be no easy way to send apps to the SD card as there used to be. How do you do that?
I want to reformat my SD card to Internal storage but am loath to do that if I am not going to be able to reload my pictures and music and at the moment I can find no way top get files from my PC to my phone. None of this feels like progress to me and I'm feeling I'd like Lollipop back - first step - enter developer mode - see 2 above!
Help!

Hi John
Me personally, I would do the factory reset and be done with it. MM has caused many issues with all devices. There are some, to which have no issues, yours apparently isn't one of them.
2 things to try. Enter recovery, and wipe cache partition, or factory reset. Try the cache wipe first, it may help.
Chris

Thanks for the reply. I've wiped the cache - no difference. A factory reset is just too drastic at this stage.
I have found a way to transfer pics and music - actually most of my pics seem to have survived anyway.
I can achieve future transfers through the use of Mega cloud backup. Bit slow, but it has the advantage of getting my critical stuff into the cloud in a very safe encrypted form (from where I can download into my phone - that works). And you get 50 Gb free (restricted monthly bandwidth, but I think I can live with that)
I just hope that Marshmallow updates will solve the other issues in time. I know I'm not alone - a friend has a Moto G2 and that is exactly the same.

Hello Johnatg, welcome to the forums! There's a bug affecting a few users after Marshmallow. The soft keys not working is one of the principal symptoms. In most cases is related to the setup wizard. One of the fixes includes starting this process from adb commands or using Nova Activities. Not sure if your custom launcher includes this option. In Nova you need to add a widget that opens SetupWizardTestActivity and then complete the process. Take a look at this thread.http://forums.androidcentral.com/sam...-dnt-work.html

Wow!! Thank you thank you thank you Javier!
I followed the link - now everything works!
To help anyone else and save you following a link, here are the instructions as copied:
Here's the fix, being broken down dummy style:
1) Download Nova Launcher & set it as default to replace TouchWiz.
2) Long press on the home screen.
3) Choose Widgets.
4) At the top, under Nova Launcher, scroll to the right & press & hold on Activities and place it somewhere empty on the home screen.
5) Scroll down to Setup Wizard. I saw 2 Setup Wizard options.
6) Under the first Setup Wizard option, I opened it & scrolled down to the 3rd choice which said ".SetupWizardTestActivity". It might be in a different spot for you, but look at the small writing, that's how I saw this one.
7) Select that to create the widget shortcut.
8) Open it. Apparently you're supposed to have a menu to go through and just click through "Next", but there wasn't one for me.
The screen just flashed and then next thing you know, everything works!
At 8, my phone took me through a whole lot of setup screens and updated some apps. Just follow them.
The only thing that didn't work then was the linking to the computer.
To fix that, see this video: USB Connection to PC Problem NOW FIXED in Android 6.0 Marshmallow !!IT Support Services UK
And now everything works!

title: SD card was unexpectedly removed, apps missing.

thread.text:
I have a Moto E 2nd generation with Android 5.1 which worked fine yesterday.
The last thing I did was to copy my photos to Dropbox and to my SD card.
Today, it took about 20 minutes for my phone to turn on with a message that it was loading the 47 apps. Now, I have a message that the SD card was unexpectedly removed and to unmount it before removing. I am missing several icons & apps including the photos icon & app. What is the best way to fix this? Thanks in advance!

This is a common issue, not just with the Moto E but a a lot of other phones. To fix, turn the phone off. Remove the SD card. Put it into your pc. Copy all the files from the card to your drive. Now format the card. Copy all your files back to the card. Reinstall into the phone and turn it on. You should be good to go.

Thank you very much! It worked. The error message went away. I am still missing the photos that were being transferred to the SD card and several icons, but I had sent the photos to Dropbox. Not sure what to do about the icons. Is the problem Android or the SD card? Again, thanks!
Probably Android but I don't really know.

title: Uninstall Google Now permanently?

thread.text:
Every once in a while, for reasons I don't understand, Google Now pops back onto my Android Moto E and starts screwing around with my home screen and other things. I'd like to turn it off and eliminate it entirely. Anyone know how?
Old Wisewiz
you can't uninstall system apps without root.

No help. I've gotten rid of it several times; I just don't remember how. There's no Feed Toggle anywhere in Google>Settings>My Feed. All the solutions I find on the Net refer to this non-existent toggle.

Have you looked in Settings, Apps? I'm not familiar with the Moto E, but you should have something similar. If nothing else you could install a disabler and deactivate it that way. They're not free, but useful for other stuff too.

Got it. If you hold your finger on the home page until the Widgets etc. choices appear at the bottom of the screen, one of the choices there is Settings. If you choose THAT Settings menu, the first screen that pops up has the Feed toggle at the top. If it doesn't, and a list of options appears instead, choose Your Feed, and that should bring up the screen with the Feed toggle at the top. Toggling that off brings up the question screen (Do you want to ...) and choosing Yes kills the Google Now window and all of its cards. Bingo!

I have all the feeds turned off, yet I still get feeds from news sources. Unfortuantly there seems no way to even disable this app. Of course, you can't delete it, since they use the old MS argument that it's part of the OS.

replies.text: Google Now.

thread.text: I thought I had that thing disabled.

Fred: If you long-press an empty space on your home page, you'll see three choices appear at the bottom of the screen: Wallpapers, Widgets, and Settings. Touch Settings and the next menu you see should have either a Feed toggle at the top or a list of menu options. If the former, toggle Feed OFF, and a confirmation screen will appear. Say Yes. If the latter, go down to Your Feed and touch that, and the Feed toggle should appear at the top of the next screen. OFF it, then confirm, and the Google Now screens and cards will stop bugging you. The extra dot indicator on your home screen that tells you there's a page you can reach by "pulling from the left" will disappear, too.
Good luck
Wisewiz

title: Stock Moto E2 on Lollipop boots up to Setup Wizard for no reason, HELP!

thread.text: My wife has been using a stock Moto E2 running Lollipop since January of 2016. This is a prepaid Verizon branded phone that we took to Tracfone with the BYOP program. The phone has worked just fine and there have been no recent changes or apps added, but recently when she went to use the phone it was on the Setup Wizard and asking for her to choose a language. We don't know what made this happen, or what to do about it. We think that if she does the setup again that she will lose her information similar to doing a factory reset. Anyone know what we should do? Any help would be appreciated.

If it's on the Setup Wizard, it most likely went through a factory reset already. This might have happened due to some catastrophic firmware glitch. I'd go through the Setup Wizard, and if it gives you the option to restore the phone, say No, and see if it dumps you back to the homescreen with all of your apps and data still intact. If everything is gone, then you could do another factory reset, go through the Setup Wizard again, and this time agree to restore the phone (and hopefully your wife had set things up to back up or sync important data to Google).
Merged duplicate threads.

replies.text:

I think card unmounting problem and my phone not being able to connect to pc by usb problem are linked.

thread.text:
Once you format your microSD card as adoptable storage it's no longer a card you can use to transfer files between external sources like your computer. The card's file structure is changed and in a sense it's become a part of your phone. You can remove it physically but as all the warning messages clearly stated you should not do so. You can't see its contents on your PC because it's now encrypted, and in such a way that it only works in conjunction with your phone.
If you need to transfer files back and forth from your phone to your computer you should either use a USB cable or a WiFi transfer app like AirDroid. Or re-format your microSD card back to external storage.

If a hub, is it a powered unit (there's a power adapter plugged into it) or one that just gets its power from the USB port it's plugged into? If it's not a powered hub try plugging your phone directly into your computer's USB port, or get a powered USB hub.

title: Missing Music Files

thread.text:
I have a Motorola Moto E running Android kitkat 4.4.4. I have a 32GB SD card on which I have been keeping all of my music files in a folder named "Music." The other day I went to play a song, and it wasn't there. I looked on my ES File Explorer on my sd card and brought up the Music folder, but it was empty. So I hooked it up to my laptop and manually added the songs back in the folder. But when I pulled up ES File Explorer again, the folder was empty. When I have it hooked up to my laptop and look in the SD card Music folder, they all show to be there. But they're not. I repeated the process with the same results. 
So this time while I had it connected to the laptop, I went to the Internal Drive - made a Music folder and uploaded the songs from the laptop to that. In ES File Explorer they show up there. When I play them they are there. But when I go into the Music folder on the SD card (via computer) the songs show to be there, but when I try to play one I get an error message. I looked at the Properties of some of the songs, and there doesn't seem to be anything there that would indicate a problem.
So I am completely stumped. I don't want to keep the music on the Internal Drive because it's almost completely full. Any ideas?

The SD card could be corrupt, defective, or counterfeit. Install SD Insight to see if the card is genuine or counterfeit. Counterfeit cards are programmed to report more storage than they actually have, and if you try saving more than the card can actually hold, then files can start getting corrupt.
If it's a valid card, then go to Settings>Storage, Unmount the card, remove it, and insert it into your computer. Can the computer read these files? Backup as much as you can right now, then run chkdsk to look for bad sectors: http://forums.androidcentral.com/amb...d-sd-card.html.

title: Why can I no longer receive MMS messages when on wifi?

thread.text: Just this past week only, I've been unable to receive mms messages without turning off wifi to download them. My phone is a Moto E (2nd gen) running Lollipop. I've looked around in the android settings as well as the message app settings (using the Messenger app by Google) and there doesn't seem to be any options that will help. I've tried doing a soft reset a couple times to no avail. Am I missing something? Is there something I need to adjust in my APN settings? It's also strange that there doesn't seem to be any rhyme or reason to why this all the sudden happened.
No android phone has been able to receive MMS via wifi. It must be carrier network unless you are on a third party app that doesn't use your phone number and uses their own servers.

I decided to make an account, so I'm the OP.
One thing I failed to add to this was that I'm through Cricket Wireless. 
Also I do not mean that I'm trying to receive MMS text through wifi only. My data is also on. I understand that I can't get mms through wifi but I should be able to get mms while wifi is on. It would be an incredible pain to turn off your wifi every bloomin time you get an mms (That even means when someone decides to tac on a couple emojis at the end of the their text - which people seem to do 90% of the time). Plus my wife and in-laws can still get mms on their phones - same exact phones, same exact plan, and yes 100% sure they're all on wifi. And no they are not using any third party apps - we're talking about the messaging app that comes default with the phone. Further more all of my co-workers (at least the ones with data plans) are able to receive mms and group texts among each other without constantly switching off of the work wifi over and over again.
In the passed day the issue has become worse. Now I can't even send/receive mms messages with wifi off. (where as before I could at least turn off wifi temporarily to read my texts). I contacted cricket support and went through a gauntlet of attempted fixes to find out that I probably have a bad SIM card that needs to be replaced at my local cricket store. So this whole issue may not fit my original question any longer - meaning my mms may not have been failing to download merely because my wifi was on. 
I'm going to post a reply here tomorrow once I get a chance to visit the cricket store. I've seen several others else where on the web with what appeared to be very similar to my current issue - so maybe this can help.

So I was able to make it out to Cricket Wireless today. I wound up not getting a new SIM card - I would have had to pay for another SIM card to be activated (which I did not expect, since my phone is still under warranty). They told me even if the new SIM card didn't work I couldn't refund the new SIM, so before doing so I decided to do a factory reset as a last ditch effort. The factory reset worked. I was finally able to send/receive mms messages not only with just data on, but also while wifi was on and active as well. 
But the story doesn't quite end there. I had to set my phone up and download all of my apps again. After downloading all of my apps and updating everything accordingly the same exact problem was back to rear it's ugly face once again. So after deleting a few apps in an effort to find a conflicting app (with no success) I decided to do yet another factory reset. Once again mms messaging worked again as expected. So now I've been in the process of adding one app at a time testing mms each time I add an app.
I'm not 100% positive but I believe the problem child was the 3rd party messenger app I was using (messenger made by google). I didn't download this app but instead set Hangouts as my default sms sender/receiver. Once I set my sms with Hangouts the same exact problems I had before began to occur. So I set my phone back to it's default messaging app and I was able to send/receive mms just as I had after the factory reset. This strikes me as a little strange because I did a little bit of troubleshooting with my 3rd party messenger very early when I first encountered issues with my messaging.
For now I'm going to call that the culprit of my messaging problems, but as I continue to add more of my apps back I'll report back to this thread if need be. But hopefully that's the last I see of my mms problems
When diagnosing these kinds of problems it is best to load an app, test , then load the the next app. That way you can pinpoint the app that is causing the problem.

title: Battery drain ? 36% to epmpty in 1 miunte

thread.text:
HI had the moto e3 for a few weeks 
its been fine until today
was on 36% battery and then next minute just switched off and when i charged it it was empty 
surely that cant be right?

There are two possible issues.
1: With it being new (or only a few weeks old), the battery may not be calibrated correctly. It's not like a gas tank that can be "measured" with a float or sensor. This is why some people have recommended in the past to run the battery down a couple times before using it normally. Nothing to do with the health of the battery, but to let the parts of the charging system that reads the battery level, learn min/max levels. It could be that it thought it had 36% left when it really didn't.
2: It's got a bad cell in the battery. It should have 36% left (see above), but the cell is faulty and doesn't hold a charge. If it's new it should be replaced. This becomes much more common as the battery ages, and is usually taken into account as a quicker drop in available % (again, see above).
thanks how do i tell which it is?

title: How to assign different sound notification

thread.text: How do I assign different sound notification for new text msg & Gmail ?
Open the app, tap Menu>Settings, and look for the Notification options. You can change the tone there. For Gmail, the Notification options are under your email account, not the General Settings.
Thanks for the prompt reply. I have gone thru the gmail settings on my laptop/ phone & cant find any settings regarding notifications. Can you give me the step by step guide please?

1. Open your Gmail app.
2. Swipe in from the left, scroll down, and tap Settings.
3. Tap your email account (between "General setting" and "Add account").
4. Tap Inbox Sound & Vibrate.
5. Tap Sound, then select your tone.
That will set the default tone for any email received on that Gmail account. But you can also set a tone for each inbox label. Under the Gmail settings, tap Manage Labels, then the inbox label you want, and then Sound to select the tone for that specific label.
Thanks for the clear steps, all done & working.

title: SD Card removed unexpectedly error in Moto E Gen 1

thread.text: I'm using moto e for over a year now. my since the last few months this error "SD card removed Unexpectedly" keeps popping up. It happens everytime when I charge my phone or connect it to USB, play specific songs or randomly too. Everytime this happens I have to eject it and insert the card again but since yesterday even when I do that within a minute or so the error pops up. Finally giving up Isearched about it on the internet I found out that it happens if i use a Class 10 SD card and if I switch to a Class 4 or 6 the problem would go away. But then I checked my SD card class it's class 4. I am using a SanDisk 8gb class 4 card. and I tried this with another car which is also class 4 8gb, sandisk. But the problem still prevails. Please help me out.

Welcome to Android Central! The SD card could be corrupt, defective, or counterfeit. Install SD Insight to see if the card is genuine or counterfeit. Counterfeit cards are programmed to report more storage than they actually have, and if you try saving more than the card can actually hold, then files can start getting corrupt.
If it's a valid card, then go to Settings>Storage, Unmount the card, remove it, and insert it into your computer. Can the computer read these files? Backup as much as you can right now, then run chkdsk to look for bad sectors: http://forums.androidcentral.com/amb...d-sd-card.html.
If the card doesn't appear corrupt, then there might be a problem with the card's SD reader. If possible, clean the SD reader's contacts with a Q-tip dipped in rubbing alcohol (or blow the slot out with a can of compressed air). If the problem persists, you may have to bring it to a repair shop.

replies.text: Thank you for the info. But both the SD cards I used on my phone, work perfectly fine in others. I guess I have to go to a shop for getting t done then.

title: Moto E2 Mobile bought in US, 3G not working in India

i see settings are proper and i have chosen "3G" in the network settings.

Have you checked if the bands of the phone's antenna are compatible with tjat of Airtel's in India? This is quite an expected occurence in phones from the US. The networks there often use different bands from the rest of the world. This can't be fixed since you can't replace phone antennas.

Welcome to Android Central! What's the exact model number of your Moto E 2015? It has to support the 2100 MHz band, since that's what Airtel uses for 3G: Network coverage in INDIA - 2G/3G/4G mobile networks. Based on these specs, you need either the XT1505 or XT1524 variants: Motorola Moto E (2nd gen) - Full phone specifications

thread.text:
When I listen to music or podcasts (I use Xbox Music and Podcast Addict apps) the playback is very choppy. It cuts in and out several times per minute. This happens on both my car bluetooth adapter (Kinivo BTC450) and my speaker at home (TDK A33).

Does the stuttering happen with any app or just those two? Trying to narrow down the issue to app-specific problems or maybe it's the Bluetooth on your device... 
You can try keeping the screen on and see if it stops (the Note 4, for instance, has a BT Stack issue and unless you keep your screen on, audio via BT 'skips' every once in a while...it's not several times per minute though, that sounds extreme).

I wonder if it is related to WiFi coverage or BT interference. It also seems to happen more while I actively use the phone.
I guess I'll keep trying and hope for the best.
Might be either interference from other devices (some traffic lights actually DO interfere with BT, especially when you're close!) or your device just not being able to handle the process load.
you might want to try switching off Wifi to confirm issue goes away.
​​while driving the phone may be trying to latch on to wifi ap's like xfinity.This may cause choppiness.
try safe mode to rule out apps influencing this..

My iPhone works great with no problems.

title: Lost moto e. No service but can still be used for wifi

thread.text: How can i close it down without an app already installed

Sorry to hear you lost your phone 
You can remotely lock or locate the device or wipe it entirely from the Google Play Device Manager (go to Google Play, sign in with the same account that your device is signed into, go to the gear icon on the right, select Device Manager). You can do this even if the phone is not online; location will report whatever was the last place it reported back and a lock/wipe command will be sent out, waiting for the device to come back online to perform it. 
However, there's a caveat: This will only work IF you didn't disable the Device Manager from your phone's administrators. Since this is an opt-in service, if you selected NO on the first set up or if you manually disabled remote controls for Device Manager, then this will not work.

title: I have a Motorola Moto E 2nd generation, how do I back up my contacts to the sim card?

thread.text: how do I out my phone contacts onto the sim card

That could depend on your carrier settings. Mine is unlocked and it came with an app called SIM toolkit where it can be done. Look for something like that in your app drawer or your carrier settings.
Just in case open your contacts app, tap on the three dots and select import/export. Maybe there's an option to export to the SIM card but I doubt it.
If you are using Google then all your contacts are online via any device.
You can do it by going in contacts>top right corner 3 dots> import/export>export to storage. And that's done.

Strongly suggest you give up on storing anything on the SIM. 
First, you can only store names and numbers on the SIM. No email addresses, physical addresses, notes, photos - no other information.
Second, there is fewer and fewer phones that even have an option to use SIM storage. In a year or two SIM storage will be gone. Some manufacturers have started a joint effort to eliminate SIM cards altogether.
SIM storage of contacts is an old, outdated, dying technology that should not be considered a viable option anymore.

title: "fast" charger? What can I use with my Moto E?

thread.text:
Can I charge moto E 2015 with any 1.5A to 2.1A charger? What max input current does it take? 
The charger provided with this phone is very slow. It takes up to 3.30 hr to charge. It's output is 5V, 550mA.
Posted via the Android Central App

Welcome to Android Central! A 550 mA charger will charge pretty slowly. A 2.1 A charger should be significantly faster, and is safe. From what I've read, the 2015 Moto E doesn't support Quick Charge 2.0.

Thanks B. Diddy
But as I have heard the phone automatically limit the input current and takes what max it can take. So basically what max current input it does support? Can I charge it with 1A or 1.5A?
Posted via the Android Central App

Phones will draw as much current as they need, so you won't be in danger of "overcharging" the phone with a charger whose max amperage exceeds what the phone will usually draw.
As a general rule of thumb, the maximum charging current for a phone's battery is equal to its mAh. So a 2000 mAh battery can draw a maximum of 2.0 A.

thread.text:
I just purchased this Verzion Moto-E 2015. I am still waiting for it to be delivered. I thought this phone should be unlocked until I see this forum. Verizon web site has the unlock policy. It's sad that this phone somehow fall into exception?? 
Prepaid Device Unlocking Policy:
We do not lock our 4G LTE Prepaid devices, and no code is needed to program them for use with another carrier.
We do not lock our 3G Prepaid devices, other than our 3G Phone-in-the-Box Prepaid phones, and the simple code to program such 3G Prepaid devices for use with another carrier is either “000000” or “123456.” If the user guide for your device does not provide instructions to access the programming menu, you can contact us at *611 from your Verizon Wireless phone, or (888)294-6804, for assistance.
Our 3G Prepaid Phone-in-the-Box phones are restricted for use with our Prepaid service for six months after activation, and are locked to the Verizon Wireless network for 12 months after activation. After six months, the restriction to our Prepaid service is automatically removed. After 12 months, you can contact us at *611 from your Verizon Wireless Prepaid phone, or (888)294-6804, and we will provide you with the programming code so that you can unlock your phone. I'm checking out Lock Delay now, and will move to trying Tasker if that doesn't pan out. Thanks again for responding. Happy whatever you're celebrating!
Oh good! Is the app Delayed Lock, or something else?

Yes, sorry, I mis-typed it. Delayed Lock it is. But it doesn't seem to work on my Moto E 2015 unless I set up the Location plug-in, and that requires that Location Services be on, but the built-in Lollipop Smart Lock does just fine with Location Services on.
I gave it about four hours of testing before I gave up, turned my Location back on, and set my Smart Lock to my home location. 
Drat! The app looks brilliant, and the author is obviously attentive to users' probs, but he can't do anything about Motorola or Lollipop 5.
Any "something else" suggestions?

It looks like these kinds of apps don't work on Lollipop, due to changes in the screen lock protocol from KitKat: PSA: 3rd party apps that bypass the security lock screen (ie Delayed Lock, SkipLock) no longer work in Lollipop | TalkAndroid.com. So I'm not sure if there are any apps that can do what you're looking for (unless perhaps if you root the phone and do some significant modification).

thread.text:
So for those who did buy the Moto e, how is it.
I mean how does it perform for a $10 phone?

replies.text: Google Play store keeps closing down on me when searching for more than one app, and I have to restart the device. For a $10 phone, though, it's really nice. Much, MUCH, nicer screen than a $50 unlocked BLU phone I bought for work, then returned.

Well it doesn't beat $600+ phones but...I would say it handles multi tasking nearly as well as my Turbo 2:http://forums.androidcentral.com/mot...ut-memory.html
And it doesn't kick ACTIVE apps out of memory like the 6S Plus. Of course, reloading apps on the iPhone is much quicker:http://forums.androidcentral.com/sam...ck-n5-now.html
AFAIK, there is no thermal throttling issues like I had on the Turbo 2 and G4 under heavy load for extended periods of time. In fact, when the Turbo 2 and G4 are under throttling, the Moto E 2nd gen actually is faster in performing tasks. 
In app, sometimes the Moto E 2nd gen will struggle a little bit...but not too bad. Scrolling sometimes isn't very smooth. 
Now the camera is not anywhere near any high priced device. In good lighting it is ok, but otherwise it is pretty meh. 
Battery life performance is quite excellent. In my usage, it gets better battery life than the Turbo 2, S6, and G4, and about the same battery life as my Note 5. Of course, everyone's usage is different, ymmv.
The display is a bit grainy, for those of us used to QHD display, it is only qHD. But honestly not bad at all. And the color is pretty good, better than my Zf2 64/4. 
Overall for $10, it is really impressive. CPU wise, it is better than the 2nd gen Moto G and the same with the 3rd gen Moto G.

Cool. I bought 2 for my nephew and niece (they've both broke their contact phones) for Christmas. I was tempted to take em out and try them lol

title: No bookmarks here (Chrome)

thread.text:
I have many bookmarks in Chrome, synced across my computers, but when I open the Chrome app on my new Android and click Bookmarks, I see the message "No bookmarks here." I have checked the sync settings in Settings. I have rebooted. I have some history from computer-browser site-visits, but no bookmarks.
I tried installing a bookmarks app, but it failed to produce my bookmarks, so I uninstalled it.
Any ideas what I can do to access my computer-browser bookmarks on my Moto E?

I have a Chromebook and a Moto running Chrome.....very recently I moved from running the Chrome Dev to Stable on Moto.......I had the " No bookmarks here " reaction show up....but all the bookmarks showed up by the following day.

Found my solution! I posted it in the General Help and How To forum, way down at the bottom of the long Problem with Android and Chrome Syncing Bookmarks thread. It wasn't intuitive, but it worked.
When I open the Chrome browser on my Moto E and hit Bookmarks in the menu, it shows Bookmarks>Mobile Bookmarks at the top of the page, and "No bookmarks here" in the centre. I clicked Bookmarks (to the left of "Mobile bookmarks," and a new page opened with three folders: Mobile bookmarks, Desktop bokmarks, and Other bookmarks. Both Mobile and Other are empty, but Desktop lists my Bookmarks Bar contents and shows another folder at the bottom of the list, called (surprise!) Bookmarks. Opened that, and voila! All of my bookmarks folders and all of their contents are listed and live!
HTH somebody. I found it by pure trial and error, with no help from the forums.

title: Recovery mode cannot be accessed

thread.text:
Hello, first of all I have read many threads with similar questions already, and seen many answers which do not work. Please don't give instructions unless you've actually tried them on a Moto E (2015) successfully. 
My problem is that I need to wipe the cache from system recovery. What I have done so far is as follows:
0) Powered off the phone
1) Holding the power and volume down for 10 seconds opens menu with options to start, restart bootloader, enter recovery mode, etc
2) Selecting 'recovery mode' using the volume keys and power button
This displays a loading animation, then opens a new screen showing 'no command' (This is a common problem from what I can see) At this point, I have no idea what to do to actually access features such as wiping cache. I have googled for answers, and found many which contradict each other. 
The steps I've tried after which have failed so far are the following:
a) after selecting recovery mode from the list of options and while the loading logo is visible, you should "Press and hold volume up and down buttons for about 4 or 5 seconds and then press power key once (while still pressing volume up and down). - Voila, the recovery mode menu will now be displayed on your new Motorola Moto E."
b) From that same site, there was also a rec to use '$ adb reboot recovery', this also led me to the 'no command' screen.
c) pressing and holding volume up for 5 seconds, then hitting power.
d) pressing and holding both volume buttons and the power button
e) pressing and holding both volume buttons for 5 seconds, then pressing the power button once.
5 to infinity) Every other permutation of pressing, holding, and releasing buttons I can think of both from the main menu, during the boot screen after selecting 'recovery', and on the 'no command' screen.
Please try to be specific about how long you press and hold things for, which exact screen you do it from, and any other details that might make a difference because whatever black magic is required to open recovery on this phone eludes me.

After trying way more combinations, I found something which works. Apparently this is specific to android 5 and above for this device.
At the 'no command' screen, press and hold the power button. After 2 seconds (keep the power button pressed throughout), also press and hold the volume UP button. Release volume up after 2 seconds. The full recovery menu should unveil itself.
My previous devices just required you to scroll to 'recovery' and click to access it - I have no idea who thought a system like this was in any way useful.

title: I have MOTO E 4G LTE (2nd Generation)2015 which is ‘unusable’.‎?

thread.text:
If I press the power button for about 30 seconds, the initiation sequence starts and progresses. ‎
When the main screen is reached it then displays: ‘unfortunately the process.com. Motorola process ‎system has stopped.’ With OK at the bottom.
‎
If I press the OK, the ‘power off’ sign appears for less than a second and the above message reappears. ‎Then if I continue to press the power button or do nothing the initiation process starts for about one ‎second then the screen goes black.‎
Apart from what is mentioned above I do not have access to ‘settings’ or in fact anything.
Is there a way around the aforementioned in order that I may have access to the contents, in order that I ‎may be able to correct/delete any unrequired contents/apps?‎

Welcome to Android Central! Did it come like this? Or did this start after installing an app?
Try booting into Safe Mode: https://motorola-global-portal.custh...kw/safe%20mode

It started during the updating of 41 apps two days ago. I have had it since May2015.‎
As indicated in my query I cannot get into the machine, being stopped from progressing when I try to press the ‎power off sign. This is only available for about one second, but even if I manage to press it, this does not seem to ‎have any effect, before the initiation restarts for a couple of seconds, before the screen goes black.‎
Therefore I am not able to go into the safe mode.
What happens if you press and hold Power for at least 15-20 seconds to force a complete shutdown? If that works, then try booting into Recovery once the phone has been shut down.

When I keep the power button pressed for about 30 seconds then the initiation process starts. It does not ‎shutdown. This means that it is continuously using power, even with nothing showing on screen. So the nearest I can get to a shutdown is by ‎letting the power level to reduce to zero %.‎
If I keep the power button pressed continuously following the start of the above process, then the initial ‎‎‘AA’sign will appear for 3 seconds, disappear for 3 seconds [black screen] and then reappear. With this ‎continuing until I stop pressing the power button.‎

Hmm, something sounds seriously wrong with either the firmware or hardware. Samsung devices require Power and Vol Down held down together for 15-20 seconds to force a shutdown. I'm not aware of Moto devices requiring this, but it's worth a try. Otherwise, I'm afraid I don't know what to try next. Sorry!
I am very grateful for your efforts. Thank you.

title: New Moto E 2015 (AT&T/Cricket) Owner, Couple of Questions

thread.text:
I picked up a Moto E 2015 GoPhone, to use on my Cricket account, at Best Buy for $75 today. They didn't have a case, but as it turns out I had bought a Moto G (1st edition?) case sometime back, thinking I was going to buy a G (but didn't), and that case fit the E 2015 almost perfectly--so I'll have protection until the case I ordered arrives.
I'd actually been eyeing higher models, like the G 2015, as I recently owned the Galaxy S5, but I can't decide what I want (Zenfone 2, Moto G 2G RAM model, Moto X Pure when it comes out, Nexus 5 2013, a number of ideas), and I was not really digging the ZTE Maven I was hobbling around on, so I got this to hobble around on while I make up my mind and save up my money; at least I'd have something smooth and decent.
So far I like it pretty good. It's smooth and not prone to hard core lag, and continues so with me now having updated to 5.1. There's nothing really to say in detail other than it just works. Most notably, unlike a ZTE Grand X Max + phablet I recently owned, it gets consistent service where I live even if only with 1-2 bars, the S5 also did, so did the ZTE Maven, but that ZTE Grand X Max + had a devil of a time doing anything here. No so with this E.
One question I have--I noticed the screen "wakes up" if I pick it up, but no matter what I tap or press, I can't get it to go from there, I instead have to press the power button the same as if it hadn't waken up to begin with. What should I be tapping or pressing?
Also, 2 apps I have installed for "timed profiles" now don't work on this phone as they had on the others. What setting (priority notifications?) could be set which is overriding those apps turning off the sounds?

I don't know much 'bout GoPhone and Cricket here in GB.....I got a Moto E 2nd Gen 2015 earlier in the year...SIM free...and still on 5.0.2....even so, if I open the case or go near it while charging, the screen "wakes up".....I too have to press the power button to go from there.
I'm not sure from reading your post whether you've already checked out the following :-
As regards the 2 apps for special attention.....it might be worth lookin' at Settings/Sound & notification / App notification...then tap on the app to see the Blocked/Priority toggles.
I'm on 5.1 with Verizon and I have to push the button. It's a feature to keep you from "pocket dialling"

I've had it for a couple of more days and can comment more on the 2 questions. 
If the phone "senses" you picking it up and turns on the clock and shows the padlock icon you can drag this icon down to get to the unlock screen (in my case, drawing a pattern) and you don't have to press the power button. You may also have other icons like email etc, you can double tap it and after unlocking it will take you to that application. Either way, I like this, it means you often don't have to press the power button to wake the phone up. 
The second question--the timed profiles apps I use, on this phone they put the phone in "priority notifications" mode, so if you have any alerts (like calls) set to alert you even in silent-vibrate mode, they will. This at first upset me, I thought I'd have to manually put the phone in silent mode using other means and lose an easy means of having timed periods of silence through the apps I've always used. That's not the case, simply turn off the "exceptions" in priority mode and it works effectively the same as before with other phones. (My ZTE Maven, despite having Android 5.1, doesn't seem to have the Lollipop "priority" features.)

Glad to read you got it all sorted for yourself. Just thought.....have you got Moto Help on the phone....the big "?" in amongst your app icons ? It is quite comprehensive and explanatory....various "how to" tutorials included.

replies.text: No I hadn't done that. I may, although at this point I've figured out enough to be OK for the moment. (This article helped a bit with the priority notifications aspect of things.) As much as I like this phone as 4.5" devices go, I'm ultimately going to want something in 5" or even 5.5" land, I'm debating between the Moto G 2015 and Asus Zenfone 2 (either one the 2G RAM model). The smoothness of this one makes me lean towards the G, although the 5.5" LCD and good reviews of the Asus interest me.

title: The performance is just...meh

thread.text:
Hello,
soo....I got Moto E 2015 couple of days ago and having been Windows Phone user for the last 5 years....I must say I now knew why I was using it for so long.
From time to time I get border of WP and then I would usually buy something with Android (I already had Motorola Atrix back in the day, LG Optimum 2x, Nexus 7, Samsung Galaxy S3) . Every time I would get Android device, first thing I would do is to transfer all that is " transferable" from my old phone and then download all the apps I use (on average around 25-30 apps). It wouldn't take more than a day for the system to slow down and for apps to start hanging. After so many years of Android existence I would always hope that the next version would finally fix this... fast forward to my new Moto E and... again disappointment.... same thing two days after, Google Play Music would crash during normal use, Outlook would hang, Kindle would take years to load after opening and closing the app 5 times and the whole launcher would crash reporting it on the screen at least 5 times a day... seriously what is this, no such a thing would EVER happen on Windows Phone, if the app crashes there it happens once in a year, if you're lucky and no matter if it's $30 device or $500. I understand that above seems like a lot of ranting, but please someone explain this to me, is that a norm that every android user should get used to or what exactly it is? I would love to enjoy the system much more, especially that Lollipop makes the design look so nice and fresh, but itself it's ruining the experience. 
Also spec wise Moto E has slightly more power than New Moto G and less pressure on the processor thanks to lower screen resolution, which should make this work even better than Moto G, so why is the performance so bleak....

I would try one of the apps that monitors the devices systems, cpu, memory, RAM etc to see if something is hogging up the resources. I am moving back to Android after another brief stint on iOS and have played with many Android phones in the store, friends phones and none of them have exhibited what you have experienced. It could be a bad phone, a rouge app. I would suggest start with a fresh hard reset, install one app at a time and see what the app is that is causing it.

Thanks. However after using windows phone and iPhone before too I must say that Android although the most open is still the most messed up and doesn't "just work" like other to do.
Posted via the Android Central App

This is an inherent problem is all Android phones. I too was a Windows Phone user(Lumia 520) for a year then sold it and bought a Moto E 2014 but thankfully i have only occasionally faced any lag or crashes or hangs. Maybe this is because of Kitkat which was specifically optimized to run on lower end devices. Lollipop on the other hand undoes that and goes back to being laggy on low end phones. So my best suggestion would be to ditch the Moto E 2015 and instead get a phone with Kitkat and turn off automatic updates because Lollipop is worse than kitkat in performance among other things. Or wait for Android 5.1 and see if that improves things.

I got it a few days ago and performance was pretty bad with constant lags, it was frustrating. I noticed that Chrome was part of the problem so I deactivated it. Yesterday I read that deactivating the Moto services would help, so I deactivated those too and since then I didn't have any problems with the phone anymore. It is fast with a fluid UI and is a joy to use now. Might be worth a try for you too to deactivate that stuff.. (I use Opera instead of Chrome)

Moto E seems to win. It comes with Lollipop, while the Transpyre starts with 4.4.2. In general, devices seem to do better when they're preinstalled with a particular version of Android, as opposed to being updated to it.
The Moto E's screen is also better--higher res (540x960 vs 480x800), and it's IPS as well, which is better than the regular LCD of the LG.
The Moto E has a weaker video camera (only 720p, as compared to the LG's 1080p video camera), and the front-facing camera is only 0.3 MP, so don't expect to take good selfies.

title: Should I buy Moto E or Galaxy S3?

thread.text:
I'm looking for an inexpensive phone for my 12 year old daughter. I can get either the SIII (base 2012 model) or the Moto E (2015 model) for the same price. I realize the S3 was a higher end device in its day, but the Moto E is a newer model. From the specs, the S3 looks to be a better deal to me (better screen, better camera, flash). So... I am leaning towards the S3, but I would value opinions from the forum.
Is there a reason I should get a Moto E over an S3?
Many thanks!
Welcome to Android Central! The S3 was only updated to 4.3, while the Moto E should come with Lollipop (not sure if 5.0 or 5.1).

Thanks for the reply! (as an aside, I can't believe this thread has had over 1,000 views and only 1 person has anything to say about my question .. :/ )
I was thinking more from a hardware perspective. 
a) Can't the S-3 be rooted and modded to run latest OS? (I am comfortable doing so. I had a couple of old android tablets that I kept up to date that way until batteries died).
b) Even if I kept it at 4.3, my daughter would mostly use the device for talking, texting and taking photos. Even though Samsung doesn't support the S3 any longer, its specs appear higher than the Moto E. Am I wrong?

You're right, the S3 specs are generally comparable or better than the Moto E. But bear in mind that age can affect hardware, especially the memory chips. So if you got a used S3 that's been much loved (i.e., used a lot), there may be a higher chance that the hardware will fail sooner than if you got a brand new Moto E. The S3 is a 3 year old phone, and my nonscientific educated guess (based on experience here) is that phones start to exhibit more problems when you hit the 2-3 year old mark.
Rooting and flashing a custom Lollipop ROM on the S3 is always an option, but remember also that these are not official, so it's not uncommon for certain features to be buggy or non-working (depending on the ROM you use).
In general, though, since your daughter will be using the phone for fairly basic functions, it won't be crucial for the phone to be on the very latest OS version--I mentioned it because some people can be very picky about this kind of thing. So the main concern I'd have would be the age of the hardware.

Thanks. Upon further research I think I will stick with my initial thought of getting the S3. Even if I keep an old os, the hardware specs are what's guiding my decision.
Posted via Android Central App

I just picked up a 2015 VZW Moto E LTE as a backup to my well used VZW S3.
Here are some pros for the Moto E LTE:Upgraded to almost the latest version of Android (5.1)Stock Android experienceModern quad-core Snapdragon 410 processor
Here are some cons for the Moto E LTE:Low resolution display (960x540)Low amount of internal storage (8GB with only about 3GB available for apps and data)Not currently rootable (at least permanent root) and in the case of Verizon's Moto E locked bootloaderNo NFC
Here are some pros for the S3:Higher resolution display (1280x720)Higher amount of internal storage (16GB)Relatively easy to root and good amount of development (although most of the devs have moved on)Has NFC
Here are some cons for the S3:TouchwizAt least with most S3's that are running stock Android 4.3 or higher, locked bootloaderUnless unused, S3's AMOLED display susceptible to burn-in

Try cleaning the cache partition.....as per...
Support Home /
Moto E (2nd Generation)
How do I clear Cache Partition on my device?
This will remove any temporary files that may be causing the problem, but will not delete your files or settings.
With the phone powered off, press and hold the Volume Down button and the Power button at the same time until the device turns on.
Press the Volume Down button to highlight "Recovery mode"
Press the Power button to restart into Recovery mode.
You'll see an image of an Android robot with a red exclamation mark.
While holding down the Power button, press the Volume Up button.
Use the volume buttons to scroll to "wipe cache partition" and press the Power button to select it.
"Reboot system now" will be highlighted, press the Power button to select it.

title: SD card

thread.text: How to move all appd to external SD card

Welcome to Android Central! Not all devices all this in an unrooted state. If it's possible on your phone, then go to Settings>Apps, select the app you want to move, and tap Move to SD, if the button is there. If you never see that button, then the device doesn't allow it. If only certain apps show that button, then the device allows it, but you still can't move every app to the SD card--it depends on how they're coded.
Be aware also that you can't move the entire app to the SD--it's only a portion of the app (and often a small one at that).
If your device doesn't allow it in an unrooted state, then you'd have to root the phone and use an app like App2SD or Link2SD.
Go to settings / Apps and just select the ones under SD category, then use the option to move them to SD

Welcome to Android Central! Put your finger on the phone icon and drag it anywhere outside the circle--that's typically how you answer it.

title: How do I set a speed dial?

thread.text: My phone is from Tracfone. I know that several posts say that there is no speed dial, but I know that isn't true... I got a call from my brother, and I was banging on things trying to answer it, and he's on my phone page clearly marked as Speed Dial next to All Contacts under my most recent call. So how do I add someone else as a speed dial? And how would I remove one?

Open your Contacts app, select a contact that you want to make a Speed Dial, and tap the star at the top. This makes the contact a Favorite, and it will then show up at the top of the Speed Dial list.
I prefer creating a folder of Direct Dial widgets on the phone screen, because then I can just call someone with one touch. To create the widget, long-press any blank area of the homescreen, then select Add Widget, and look for the Direct Dial widget. Press and hold it, then drag it to the homescreen. When you release, it will ask you to select a contact for the widget, and also which phone number. When complete, just touching the widget will call that number.
You can then create a folder of Direct Dial widgets and call it Speed Dial. Just create more of the widgets, and make a folder, drag one of them on top of another. The folder will form, and you can name it. Then drag other Direct Dial widgets into it. You should be able to put 16 widgets in each folder.
